perturbation.original_text: (c) Payment of License Fees shall be made in Canadian funds in arrears within thirty (30) days following each calendar month during the Term in which Licensed Programs were exhibited hereunder and shall be accompanied by a statement of account showing the calculation of the License Fees.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) Payment of License Fees shall be made in Canadian funds in arrears within sixty (60) days following each calendar quarter during the Term in which Licensed Programs were exhibited hereunder and shall be accompanied by a statement of account showing the calculation of the License Fees.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires payment of license fees within 30 days of each calendar month. The modified text changes this to within 60 days of each calendar quarter. This creates a delay in payment that could conflict with provincial regulations regarding timely payment for services or royalties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with provincial laws in Canada regarding payment terms and frequency, or industry standards for royalty payments which typically mandate more frequent payments.

perturbation.original_text: Licensor will deliver accurate, representative samples of all such advertising and promotions to Rogers at least five (5) business days in advance for Rogers' prior review and approval.
perturbation.changed_text: Licensor will deliver accurate, representative samples of all such advertising and promotions to Rogers at least one (1) business day in advance for Rogers' prior review and approval.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that the licensor provides the advertising samples 5 business days in advance to Rogers to approve. By changing the number of days to one (1) it is creating the possibility for the advertising promotions to be late and disrupt the timeline of the contract. This is inconsistent with the minimum notice periods for marketing materials, especially if any changes are needed.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with reasonable standards for marketing material review, which allows a sufficient period for assessment and feedback.

perturbation.original_text: Such Masters shall at all times remain the sole property of Licensor and, within fifteen (15) days following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, Rogers shall either return to Licensor all such Masters then in its possession, or issue a certificate of erasure.
perturbation.changed_text: Such Masters shall at all times remain the sole property of Licensor and, within sixty (60) days following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, Rogers shall either return to Licensor all such Masters then in its possession, or issue a certificate of erasure.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires Rogers to return the master copies within 15 days, which is creating an unnecessary extension. This can affect licensor's distribution rights.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially conflicts with the Canadian Copyright Act with respect to timely return of materials.
